content.description:
This is a short, hand-sized crack on the R side of the Three Buffoons formation.  It may be used as a warm up for Anus Great, to its L.  It remains in the shade in the morning.  It is for the seekers of the obscure & close or the cogno-lost.

Move up the lower block on the with the crack on the right and gain a ledge.  Continue up along a mostly-hands crack to the top.  50 ft.  Walkoff L.

Beware of leaving your rope piled up in poison ivy.
content.protection: Mostly hand sized-cams.  6x48 inch slings off the tree for a TR.

content.description:
This is a short, fun, face climb on the left side of the Three Buffoons formation.  If you are there, it begs to be climbed.  It may have been previously done (maybe with a different name), but judging on the lichen, not too recently.  It remains in the shade in the morning.  It is for the seekers of the obscure & close or the cogno-lost.

Move up the lower block to the right to gain access to this undercut face.  Traverse in from the right, gain an undercling, reach high for holds & yard/thrutch up to a stance (crux).  Continue up easier terrain to the top.  50 feet.  Walk off left.

This is on the fatter side of 1 star.

This favors an average to taller climber.
content.protection: 6 x 48 in & 2 x 24 in slings for a TR or a huge crash pad.

climbs.name: Anus Great
climbs.fa: P. Ament, Van Freeman, & J. Dahlstrom, 1970

content.description:
This is a short, wide (fists & offwidth) crack on the R side of the Three Buffoons formation.  It carries an odd name with unclear history.  It remains in the shade in the morning.  It is for the seekers of the obscure & close or the cogno-lost.

Move up the lower block on the left (looser), arete (no pro, 5.7), or the crack on the right (hands) and gain a ledge.  Offwidth or face climb the bulgy start, get into the crack, and you are done, 50 feet.  Walk off left.

This is on the lean side of 1 star.

Beware of leaving your rope piled up in poison ivy.
content.protection: 3-5 cams in the #3 to 4 Camalot size.  Or 6x48 inch slings to TR off the tree.
